Other common uses of OLTP include - ATMs - E-commerce software - Credit card payment processing, - Online flight bookings - Hotel reservation systems #### OLAP vs OLTP

## Charactaristics of an EDW  Regardless of whether the architecture is based on the Inmon or the Kimball design, all EDW share the following common charactaristics  ### Function-oriented - A data warehouse is oriented around different functions of the business, such as sales, inventory, marketing, since it provides information about each of these departments rather than the overall processes of a business - For example, if you want to analyse your company’s sales data, you need to build a data warehouse that concentrates on sales.

Such a warehouse would provide valuable information like ‘who was your best customer last year?’ or ‘who is likely to be your best customer in the coming year?’  ### Integrated - A data warehouse is developed by integrating data from varied sources into a consistent format.

#### Features of Snowflake  - No hardware required - Almost no software installation is required - Fully managed service means no software upgrades or maintenance is needed - Can easily scale up or down as needed - Provides a user-friendly web interface that data engineers can use along with advanced command line features  For more details, check Snowflake's [homepage](https//docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/intro-key-concepts.html)  ### Google BigQuery   BigQuery is also a fully-managed cloud-based EDW that provides advanced features like machine learning and geospatial analysis  BigQuery uses a server-less architecture which provides flexibility in how to deploy the tool as it seperates the computation enginge from the data storage.

For more details, check Redshift's [homepage](https//aws.amazon.com/redshift/)  ### Snowflake   Snowflake is a fully managed cloud-based service that provides a single platform which includes data warehousing, big data lakes, and provides support for data engineering, data science and advanced data sharing  This tool has been quickly gaining popularity in recent years especially by global companies.

'## Key Takeaways  - Databases and data warehouses are still widely popular tools for dealing with structured data in global companies - Traditionally, EDWs were hosted on-premise and required expensive hardware and costly skilled experts to maintain - An enterprise data warehouse (EDW) is not only a database.
